newsitem.title: USA: Vantive tumbles, analysts cite projection.
newsitem.headline: Vantive tumbles, analysts cite projection.

text.p: Vantive Corp shares tumbled Friday, losing more than 25 percent of their value after the company told analysts it expects revenue growth to be flat in the next two quarters.
Vantive officials were not immediately available for comment. Vantive shares were off 10-1/2 to 30-1/4 by early afternoon on volume of more than 3.8 million.
"They said in their guidance for the fourth and the first quarter that revenue would be flat to slightly up sequentially," said Ed Bierdeman, analyst at L.H. Alton Co.
Kathleen Murphy, Vantive chief financial officer, said in a conference call with analysts this morning that the company could not sustain quarterly growth without a larger sales and marketing staff.

"Most sequential growth for 1996 has already occurred, and revenue for the fourth and first quarter will likely be flat to moderately up over third-quarter revenues," Murphy said in a recording of the conference call.
